title: Spice Lux luxury responsive marketing website (Home, About, Products, Testimonials, Contact) with WhatsApp enquiry

1. Home Page ... 6. Contact Page

acceptanceCriteria: Site renders all specified sections with the exact headline and CTA labels provided.
Navigation allows users to access each section/page on desktop and mobile.
Layout is mobile-first and remains usable at common breakpoints (mobile/tablet/desktop).

requirements.text: Apply a consistent luxury brand visual theme using the provided palette (deep red, matte black, gold highlights, natural green accents), including typography, spacing, and component styling (buttons, cards, navbar) suitable for a premium Indian spices brand.

acceptanceCriteria: Primary/secondary/background/accent colors reflect the provided palette across the whole site.

requirements.text: Implement a sticky navbar with clear links to the main sections (Home, About, Products, Why Choose, Testimonials, Contact), including a responsive mobile menu.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar remains visible while scrolling on desktop and mobile.
Mobile menu is accessible and can be opened/closed; links scroll/navigate to the correct section.

requirements.text: Create the Contact section/page including a contact form, displayed phone number and email, a WhatsApp ‚ÄúOrder Now‚Äù button, and a Google Maps location embed.

acceptanceCriteria: Contact form includes basic fields (name, email/phone, message) with client-side validation and a clear success/error state.
Phone number and email are visible and clickable (tel: and mailto: links).
Google Maps embed renders in the Contact section/page.

requirements.text: Persist Contact form submissions to the Motoko canister (single-actor backend) via a dedicated submission method and expose a query method to verify saved submissions during development/testing.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the form calls the backend and stores the submission (name, contact, message, timestamp).
Backend exposes a query method that returns saved submissions for verification.
Frontend displays a user-friendly confirmation after a successful submission and an error message on failure.

requirements.text: Add smooth, lightweight animations and SEO-friendly structure (semantic headings, meta title/description, accessible landmarks) while keeping the site fast-loading.
acceptanceCriteria: Animations are subtle (e.g., fade/slide-in) and do not block interaction or degrade performance.
Pages/sections use semantic structure (H1/H2 hierarchy) and include appropriate meta tags.
Lighthouse-style checks show no obvious SEO/accessibility anti-patterns (e.g., missing alt text).

requirements.text: Organize the project with a clean folder structure and production-ready, readable code with concise comments where helpful (especially around WhatsApp integration and form submission flow).
acceptanceCriteria: Key modules/components are separated logically (layout, sections, shared components).
Non-obvious logic includes short explanatory comments.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets for the hero and products under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the Home hero and Products cards (do not serve images from the backend).

quotes: Hero section with premium spice photography

Each product card should include:

Image placeholder

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist at frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Hero uses the hero image; each product card uses its corresponding product image with descriptive alt text.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Frontend must remain within React + TypeScript + Tailwind + Shadcn + React Query constraints.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose them instead.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add migration.mo only if upgrading existing persisted state is required.
No third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is supported (do not add other auth).
No external databases or server-side email/SMS services; contact submissions should be stored on-canister if persistence is required.
nonGoals: Admin dashboard for managing products/testimonials/enquiries (beyond a simple backend query for verification).
Integration with external CRM/email delivery services.
